00038 static const int i_OriginalDelay = ESCDELAY;
00040 static int i_NcursesDeviceCount = 0;
00041 
00042 
00044 #define CLI_NCURSES_CONSOLE GetNcursesConsoleTraceClass()
00046 static const TraceClass& GetNcursesConsoleTraceClass(void)
00047 {
00048     static const TraceClass cli_NcursesConsoleTraceClass("CLI_NCURSES_CONSOLE", Help()
00049         .AddHelp(Help::LANG_EN, "CLI ncurses console traces")
00050         .AddHelp(Help::LANG_FR, "Traces de la console ncurses du CLI"));
00051     return cli_NcursesConsoleTraceClass;
00052 }

00054 Console::Console(const bool B_AutoDelete)
00055   : IODevice("ncurses-console", B_AutoDelete),
00056     m_pData(NULL)
00057 {
00058     // Does nothing but registers the appropriate trace classes.
00059     GetTraces().Trace(CLI_NCURSES_CONSOLE);
00060 }
00061 
00062 Console::~Console(void)
00063 {
00064     Console::CloseDevice();
00065 }
00066 
00067 const bool Console::OpenDevice(void)
00068 {
00069     if (m_pData == NULL)
00070     {
00071         // Configure ncurses
00072 
00073         // Regular ncurses configuration.
00074         WINDOW* const p_Window = initscr();
00075         raw(); // Use raw() instead of cbreak(), since we also want to trap the control character sequences.
00076         noecho();
00077         // Additional configuration.
00078         scrollok(p_Window, TRUE); // Enable scrolling.
00079         keypad(p_Window, TRUE); // Enable arrow keys.
00080         ESCDELAY = 0; // Change the escape delay to none instead of 1000 ms by default.
00081 
00082         m_pData = p_Window;
00083 
00084         i_NcursesDeviceCount ++;
00085     }
00086 
00087     if (m_pData == NULL)
00088     {
00089         m_cliLastError
00090             .SetString(ResourceString::LANG_EN, "ncurses configuration failed")
00091             .SetString(ResourceString::LANG_FR, "La configuration de ncurses a échoué");
00092         return false;
00093     }
00094     else
00095     {
00096         return true;
00097     }
00098 }
00099 
00100 const bool Console::CloseDevice(void)
00101 {
00102     if (m_pData != NULL)
00103     {
00104         m_pData = NULL;
00105 
00106         i_NcursesDeviceCount --;
00107         if (i_NcursesDeviceCount <= 0)
00108         {
00109             // Restore original escape delay.
00110             ESCDELAY = i_OriginalDelay;
00111         }
00112 
00113         endwin();
00114     }
00115 
00116     return true;
00117 }
00118 
00119 const KEY Console::GetKey(void) const
00120 {
00121     // ncurses constants.
00122     static const int NC_KEY_UP = KEY_UP;
00123         #undef KEY_UP
00124     static const int NC_KEY_DOWN = KEY_DOWN;
00125         #undef KEY_DOWN
00126     static const int NC_KEY_LEFT = KEY_LEFT;
00127         #undef KEY_LEFT
00128     static const int NC_KEY_RIGHT = KEY_RIGHT;
00129         #undef KEY_RIGHT
00130     static const int NC_KEY_END = KEY_END;
00131         #undef KEY_END
00132 
00133     while (1)
00134     {
00135         const int i_Char = getch();
00136         GetTraces().Trace(CLI_NCURSES_CONSOLE) << "i_Char = " << i_Char << endl;
00137         switch (i_Char)
00138         {
00139         // Breakers.
00140         case 27:
00141             do {
00142                 nodelay((WINDOW*) m_pData, TRUE);
00143                 const int i_Char2 = getch();
00144                 nodelay((WINDOW*) m_pData, FALSE);
00145                 GetTraces().Trace(CLI_NCURSES_CONSOLE) << "i_Char2 = " << i_Char2 << endl;
00146                 switch (i_Char2)
00147                 {
00148                 // Escape character.
00149                 case ERR:   return cli::ESCAPE;
00150                 // ALT sequences
00151                 case 'c':   return cli::COPY;
00152                 case 'x':   return cli::CUT;
00153                 case 'v':   return cli::PASTE;
00154                 case 'z':   return cli::UNDO;
00155                 case 'y':   return cli::REDO;
00156                 case NC_KEY_LEFT:   return PAGE_LEFT;
00157                 case NC_KEY_RIGHT:  return PAGE_RIGHT;
00158                 default:
00159                     // Unknown ALT sequence.
00160                     break;
00161                 }
00162             } while(0);
00163             break;
00164 
00165         // Deletions.
00166         case KEY_BACKSPACE: return cli::BACKSPACE;
00167         case KEY_DC:        return cli::DELETE;
00168         case KEY_IC:        return cli::INSERT;
00169 
00170         // Movements
00171         case NC_KEY_UP:     return cli::KEY_UP;
00172         case KEY_PPAGE:     return cli::PAGE_UP;
00173         case NC_KEY_DOWN:   return cli::KEY_DOWN;
00174         case KEY_NPAGE:     return cli::PAGE_DOWN;
00175         case NC_KEY_LEFT:   return cli::KEY_LEFT;
00176         case NC_KEY_RIGHT:  return cli::KEY_RIGHT;
00177         case KEY_HOME:      return cli::KEY_BEGIN;
00178         case NC_KEY_END:    return cli::KEY_END;
00179 
00180         // Accentuated characters
00181         case 225:           return cli::KEY_aacute;
00182         case 224:           return cli::KEY_agrave;
00183         case 228:           return cli::KEY_auml;
00184         case 226:           return cli::KEY_acirc;
00185         case 231:           return cli::KEY_ccedil;
00186         case 233:           return cli::KEY_eacute;
00187         case 232:           return cli::KEY_egrave;
00188         case 235:           return cli::KEY_euml;
00189         case 234:           return cli::KEY_ecirc;
00190         case 237:           return cli::KEY_iacute;
00191         case 236:           return cli::KEY_igrave;
00192         case 239:           return cli::KEY_iuml;
00193         case 238:           return cli::KEY_icirc;
00194         case 243:           return cli::KEY_oacute;
00195         case 242:           return cli::KEY_ograve;
00196         case 246:           return cli::KEY_ouml;
00197         case 244:           return cli::KEY_ocirc;
00198         case 250:           return cli::KEY_uacute;
00199         case 249:           return cli::KEY_ugrave;
00200         case 252:           return cli::KEY_uuml;
00201         case 251:           return cli::KEY_ucirc;
00202 
00203         // Special characters.
00204         case 96:            return BACK_QUOTE;
00205         case 163:           return POUND;
00206         case 167:           return PARAGRAPH;
00207         case 176:           return DEGREE;
00208         case 178:           return SQUARE;
00209         case 181:           return MICRO;
00210 
00211         // Control sequences.
00212         case 1:             return cli::KEY_BEGIN;  // CTRL+A
00213         case 3:             return cli::BREAK;      // CTRL+C
00214         case 4:             return cli::LOGOUT;     // CTRL+D
00215         case 5:             return cli::KEY_END;    // CTRL+E
00216         case 12:            return cli::CLS;        // CTRL+L
00217         case 14:            return NEXT;            // CTRL+N
00218         case 16:            return PREVIOUS;        // CTRL+P
00219         case 25:            return cli::REDO;       // CTRL+Y
00220         case 407:           return cli::UNDO;       // CTRL+Z
00221 
00222         // Function keys.
00223         case 265:           return F1;
00224         case 266:           return F2;
00225         case 267:           return F3;
00226         case 268:           return F4;
00227         case 269:           return F5;
00228         case 270:           return F6;
00229         case 271:           return F7;
00230         case 272:           return F8;
00231         case 273:           return F9;
00232         case 274:           return F10;
00233         case 275:           return F11;
00234         case 276:           return F12;
00235 
00236         default:
00237             {
00238                 // Call the base implementation.
00239                 const KEY e_Char = IODevice::GetKey(i_Char);
00240                 if (e_Char != NULL_KEY)
00241                 {
00242                     return e_Char;
00243                 }
00244             }
00245         }
00246     }
00247 }
00248 
00249 void Console::PutString(const char* const STR_Out) const
00250 {
00251     char str_Char[2] = { '\0', '\0' };
00252 
00253     if (STR_Out != NULL)
00254     {
00255         const unsigned int ui_Len = strlen(STR_Out);
00256         for (unsigned int ui=0; ui<ui_Len; ui++)
00257         {
00258             str_Char[0] = STR_Out[ui];
00259             // Possible translation of certain character here...
00260             addstr(str_Char);
00261         }
00262         refresh();
00263     }
00264 }

00268     beep();

00271 void Console::CleanScreen(void) const

00273     erase();
00274 }
